p: Italy recorded its first COVID-19 pandemic event on January 31, 2020, when two tourists coming from China were found to be virus-positive in Rome [4]. On February 20, new outbreaks were detected in Codogno, Lodi province, Lombardy region, in terms of 16 infected people, summing up to 60 on the following day and causing the first deaths soon after [5], [6], [7], [8]. The patient identified as Case 1 was a 38-year old man from Codogno having respiratory tract infection signs. His wife and a close friend were also found COVID-19-positive [5] so that 13 municipalities in Lombardy and one in Veneto were immediately isolated to fulfil contagion containment procedures [9]. Fig. 1, Fig. 2, Fig. 3 depict the evolution pattern of the epidemic in Italy throughout April 18, 2020 showing some slight positive signals, despite an overall long-lasting trend.
